snippet: The agency is requiring the replacement of cockpit displays on 737 and 777 jets within the next five years to avoid interference from Wi-Fi and cellular devices.
abstract: Federal Aviation Administration is requiring airlines to replace cockpit displays on Boeing's 737 and 777 jets--more than 1,300 airplanes--within next five years to avoid interference from Wi-Fi and cellular devices.
lead_paragraph: The agency is requiring the replacement of cockpit displays on 737 and 777 jets within the next five years to avoid interference from Wi-Fi and cellular devices.

headline.main: F.A.A. Tells Airlines to Replace Some Boeing Cockpit Displays
headline.print_headline: F.A.A. Tells Airlines to Replace Some Boeing Cockpit Displays
